comments.body: This actually looks like it might be worth to add :) However, I have other projects I want to work on

> This actually looks like it might be worth to add :) However, I have other projects I want to work on

i got shit loads of api keys if you want

I can't find out how to download. I found out, however, that I can use https://api.prodia.com/job/{JOB_ID} to see if the image was finished. Supposedly, you can also [download from here](https://github.com/zenafey/prodiapy/blob/main/prodia/async_prodia.py#L130C29-L130C75), but I couldn't get that to work, since there was no field for that in the returned json.

title: Fix dependencies
author: mak448a
body: I should update the dependencies in requirements.txt. Probably no extra intervention is needed, so anyone can submit a pull request for this if I don't get around to it. Or just ask me here

title: GUI
author: mak448a
body:
Maybe add a gui with pyside6
It would have a `run bot` button
And a settings pane for entering in credentials

Not very high on priorities.

comments.body: There's not really a need for this. That's a bit excessive for a Discord bot. If you would like it, comment on this thread.

title: Looking for Maintainers
author: mak448a
body: I don't use Discord that much anymore, because I prefer to use privacy respecting messengers. If anyone likes this project, please consider maintaining it!

title: Allow executing without horde module
author: mak448a
body: I have horde module which is licensed under GPL, but this project is MIT. I'd like to try to decouple the two as much as possible.

title: More llms: Llama3 & Mixtral with Groq api
author: mak448a
body: Add more llms and llama 3 in addition to ChatGPT. Maybe even some reworks in the llm modules.

comments.body: No mixtral yet. Open issue if you need it.

title: Imaginepy is broken
author: mak448a
body:
**Describe the bug**
Using /imaginepy doesn't work
https://github.com/ItsCEED/Imaginepy/issues/7

**To Reproduce**
Just run /imaginepy on Discord

**Workaround**
Manually install imaginepy from https://github.com/ItsCEED/Imaginepy

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Python Version: 3.10

comments.body: The latest version of Imaginepy is out, which fixes this issue.

> The latest version of Imaginepy is out, which fixes this issue.

brother are you sure ?
I'll try it out and reopen if it's not working
